IT IS OUR UNDERSTANDING ON 9/17/08 CLIENT SPOKE WITH FA AND INSTRUCTED HIM TO LIQUIDATE HER ENTIRE PORTFOLIO.  FA ADVISED AGAINST SELLING BASED ON EMOTIONS; HOWEVER, THE PORTFOLIO WAS LIQUIDATED. FA STATED CLIENT INFORMED HIM SHE HAD INVESTED IN MUNICIPAL BONDS IN THE PAST AND THE DETAILS OF THE WEST VIRGINIA HOSPITAL BOND WERE REVIEWED.  FA FURTHER STATED CLIENT ATTENDED WVU AND SHE WAS FAMILIAR WITH THE HOSPITALS ISSUING THE BOND. SINCE THIS PURCHASE REPRESENTED 15% OF THE CLIENT'S STATED NET WORTH, CLIENT SIGNED A BUY ACKNOWLEDGMENT LETTER CONFIRMING HER UNDERSTANDING OF THE BOND FEATURES AND RISKS, INCLUDING MARKET FLUCTUATION. FA INDICATED CLIENT HAD READ AN ARTICLE IN THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER RELATING TO THE DECLINE IN VALUE OF WV'S INVESTMENTS AND CLIENT NO LONGER HAD FAITH IN THE STATE OF WV.
